Package com.cafean.jobstream.common

Class PlatformModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cafean.jobstream.common.PlatformModule
  • public abstract class PlatformModule
extends java.lang.Object
    Platform Modules serve as the interface between the Job Stream system and a given computing environment (i.e. "cluster"). This includes job submission as well as file access to and from the staging location.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description

      a status indicating that the task has completed

      a status indicating that the task is currently in the queue waiting to be processed
      static int STATUS_RUNNING
      a status indicating that the task is currently running
      static int STATUS_UNAVAILABLE
      a status indicating that the task's status cannot be determined

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlatformModule

        public PlatformModule()
        Creates a new instance of this platform module type.

        PlatformModule implementations should defer all initialization to initialize(StreamLogger,boolean) or lazily initialize in each accessor to avoid unnecessary start-up overhead for unused PlatformModules.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public boolean initialize​(StreamLogger logger,
                          boolean client)
        Performs any necessary initializations just before the module is used. Modules that do not require start-up initialization should simply return the result of this base implementation.

        Note that all available platform modules are initialized when loaded by the client side of the system.

        Parameters:
        logger - the StreamLogger instance for this PlatformModule that can be used to display error/warning/info messages to the user or log file depending on where this module is loaded.
        client - true if this module is being initialized for client side usage
        Returns:
        true for success; false for failure
        See Also:
        critical(String), error(String), warning(String), info(String)

      • getName

        public abstract java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of this module as it will appear in site configuration files.
        Returns:
        a String containing the module name.

      • isSSHSupported

        public boolean isSSHSupported()
        Returns true if this PlatformModule uses SSH for stream submission and/or file transfer to the staging location. This method is used to indicate whether SSH/SCP related properties will be displayed when configuring platform definitions that use this platform module.

        The default implementation of this method returns false.

        Returns:
        true if SSH is supported; false otherwise.

      • isTimestampConfigurable

        public boolean isTimestampConfigurable()
        Returns true if this PlatformModule uses a configurable timestamp format.

        The default implementation of this method returns true.

      • isTrackingServerSupported

        public boolean isTrackingServerSupported()
        Returns true if this PlatformModule includes support for a Tracking Server.

        The default implementation of this method returns false.

      • getStatus

        public int[] getStatus​(java.lang.String[] batchIDs,
                       PlatformProperties properties)
        Queries the platform (i.e. "queuing system") to determine the status of the task with the given batch ID and returns the status as one of the following enumerated values:
        • STATUS_UNAVAILABLE
        • STATUS_QUEUED
        • STATUS_RUNNING
        • STATUS_COMPLETED
        • STATUS_FAILED
        This base implementation returns STATUS_UNAVAILABLE.

        Note: STATUS_UNAVAILABLE may be returned after a job has completed if the queuing system does not maintain a list of completed tasks.

        Parameters:
        batchIDs - a String[] containing the batch IDs returned by submitStream or submitWrapper.
        properties - the PlatformProperties describing the current platform.
        Returns:
        the status of the given task as one of the enumerated values defined above
        See Also:
        submitStream(SubmitContext, Progress), submitWrapper(PlatformProperties, SubmitContext), submitWrappers(PlatformProperties, List), getQueueCheckInterval(PlatformProperties)

      • isTaskLevelStatusSuported

        public boolean isTaskLevelStatusSuported()
        Returns true if this platform module supports the retrieval of not just batch job status but task-specific status information.
        See Also:
        getStatus(List, PlatformProperties)

      • getStatus

        public java.util.List<Status> getStatus​(java.util.List<Task> tasks,
                                        PlatformProperties properties)
        Queries the platform (i.e. "queuing system") and returns the status of each of the given tasks. The Status.Unprocessed status will be interpreted by the Stream Manager as no status change, and should be returned unless an exact status can be determined.

        This base implementation returns a list containing Status.Unprocessed for each given task.

        Parameters:
        tasks - a List<Task> the tasks for which status is requested
        properties - the PlatformProperties describing the current platform.
        Returns:
        the Status of the given tasks
        See Also:
        isTaskLevelStatusSuported(), getQueueCheckInterval(PlatformProperties)

      • isEditorEnabled

        public boolean isEditorEnabled​(PlatformDefinition platform,
                               PlatformProperties properties)
        Returns true if this platform module provides an editing dialog for the given platform.
        Parameters:
        platform - the PlatformDefinition describing the platform
        properties - the PlatformProperties that may be edited
        Returns:
        true if the platform properties editor should be displayed

      • openEditor

        public boolean openEditor​(javax.swing.JComponent parent,
                          PlatformDefinition platform,
                          PlatformProperties properties)
        Opens a GUI editing dialog for use in editing the platform properties of an entire job stream appropriate for this PlatformModule.
        Parameters:
        parent - the JComponent parent for any dialogs created by this method
        platform - the PlatformDefinition read from site configuration
        properties - the PlatformProperties to edit
        Returns:
        true for success; false for failure or canceled

        Parameters:

        properties - the SubmissionProperties that may be edited

      • reset

        public void reset​(PlatformDefinition platform,
                  PlatformProperties properties)
        Resets the given platform properties to a valid initial state based on the given Platform Definition.

        This base implementation clears the properties object.

        Parameters:

        properties - the PlatformProperties to reset
        See Also:

        See Also:
        PlatformDefinition.reset(PlatformProperties)

      • getProtocolOverrides

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> getProtocolOverrides​(PlatformProperties properties)
        Returns a map of protocol overrides that are required by this module on the given platform. This is only typically necessary when using a staging location other than a block storage device. In that case, the module would be required to override both the 'task' and 'jsstage' file accessors.
        Parameters:
        properties - the PlatformProperties describing the current platform
        Returns:
        properties a Map of protocol vs accessor id

      • update

        public void update​(PlatformDefinition platform,
                   PlatformProperties properties)
        Updates any part of the given platform properties that should match the PlatformDefinition during the submission process.

        This base implementation updates the SNAP installation folder of the properties object to match that of the platform definition.

        Parameters:
        platform - the PlatformDefinition read from site configuration
        properties - the PlatformProperties to update

      • update

        public void update​(PlatformDefinition platform,
                   SubmissionProperties properties)
        Updates any part of the given submission properties that should match the PlatformDefinition during the submission process.

        This base implementation does nothing.

        Parameters:
        platform - the PlatformDefinition read from site configuration
        properties - the SubmissionProperties to update

      • check

        public boolean check​(boolean silent,
                     PlatformDefinition platform)
        Checks the given platform definition to determine if any settings have been left unset or set incorrectly. Any errors, warnings, or messages that should be displayed during the check should use the standard logging methods (error,warning, etc.) included in this base class.
        Parameters:
        silent - if true, no messages should be
        platform - the PlatformDefinition to examine for errors
        Returns:
        true if no issues were discovered in the check

      • terminate

        public abstract void terminate​(java.util.List<TerminateContext> contexts)
        Requests the termination of the jobs described by the given terminate context objects.

        Terminating jobs is a process often performed in parallel and thus the results must be reported in parallel. To this end, the resulting success or failure to terminate each task must be recorded in the corresponding context object by calling the available accessors on each context (setFailure, setFailureMessage, setFailureStatus, etc.).

        Parameters:
        contexts - a List of TerminateContext objects that describe each of the jobs that should be terminated.

      • submitSequence

        public java.lang.String submitSequence​(SubmitContext context,
                                       Progress progress)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Submits a Sequence Manager job using the given context.
        Parameters:
        context - a SubmitContext containing all of the information necessary to submit the desired sequence.
        progress - the Progress to update on the progress of the submission
        Returns:
        a String containing the ID assigned to the job by the platform's queuing system.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - to describe errors during the submission process

      • submitStream

        public abstract java.lang.String submitStream​(SubmitContext context,
                                              Progress progress)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Submits a Stream Manager job using the given context.
        Parameters:
        context - a SubmitContext containing all of the information necessary to submit the desired job stream.
        progress - the Progress to update on the progress of the submission
        Returns:
        a String containing the ID assigned to the job by the platform's queuing system.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - to describe errors during the submission process

      • submitWrapper

        public abstract java.lang.String submitWrapper​(PlatformProperties properties,
                                               SubmitContext context)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Submits an Execution Wrapper job using the given context.
        Parameters:
        properties - a PlatformProperties object describing the target platform
        context - a SubmitContext containing all of the information necessary to submit the desired execution wrapper.
        Returns:
        a String containing the ID assigned to the job by the platform's queuing system.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - to describe errors during the submission process

      • submitWrappers

        public java.lang.String submitWrappers​(PlatformProperties properties,
                                       java.util.List<SubmitContext> contexts)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Submits a job that will run an Execution Wrapper for each of the given submit contexts.

        Note that a task definition has been exported for each context when this method is called. If, during the course of the stream, a task is precluded by the failure of an upstream task then its task definition will removed from disk. It is recommended that module implementations take this behavior into account where possible to avoid loading Execution Wrappers for tasks that will not be executed.

        Parameters:
        properties - a PlatformProperties object describing the target platform
        contexts - a List<SubmitContext> containing the information necessary to submit the desired execution wrappers.
        Returns:
        a String containing the ID assigned to the job by the platform's queuing system.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this module does not support task bundling.
        java.io.IOException - to describe errors during the submission process

      • getBundleDetails

        public BundlePropertyDetails getBundleDetails​(PlatformProperties properties,
                                              java.util.List<Task> tasks)
                                       throws InvalidBundleDetailsException
        This method returns a bundle property details object that will be used to add additional columns to the bundling display. These additional columns of site-specific data will be presented to the user as an estimate of the resources that will be requested for the batch job.

        The details include a set of column names/headers and the set of values for each column that the given batch job uses.

        The columns displayed in the table will be the union of all details columns returned by all of the getBundleDetails calls for the stream.

        Warning: Due to the fact that the bundle details are being retrieved and displayed on the client without submitting the stream, the given SubmitContext objects cannot be fully initialized.

        Parameters:
        properties - the PlatformProperties for the stream
        tasks - the List of Task objects whose properties should be combined and displayed
        Returns:
        a BundlePropertyDetails object or null if the bundle property details feature is not supported by this platform module.
        Throws:
        InvalidBundleDetailsException - to describe problems with the given bundle.

      • sendToStagingLocation

        public abstract java.lang.String sendToStagingLocation​(java.io.File file,
                                                       java.lang.String streamName,
                                                       java.lang.String relativeLocation,
                                                       PlatformProperties properties,
                                                       Progress progress)
                                                throws java.io.IOException
        Sends the given file to the staging location from a client application and returns the location at which the file can be referenced from server side processes.

        Extensions of this class that also implement isUsingLocalMount may implement this transfer as a single call to FileUtils.copyFile(File, File, byte[], Progress) using a local folder location resolved using FileUtils.getFolderByRelativePath(Architecture, String, String[]). The returned staging location can then be resolved using FileUtils.getFolderByRelativePath(Architecture, String, String[]).

        Parameters:
        file - a File referring to the file to send
        streamName - a String containing the user-specified name of the stream
        relativeLocation - a String containing the relative target location of the file on the staging location '/' as the separator character.
        properties - the PlatformProperties describing the platform who's staging location the file should be copied to
        progress - the Progress instance to which the status should be reported
        Returns:
        a String containing the full path to the file on the staging location for use by the server side execution process
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - for any error during the transmission process
        See Also:
        isUsingLocalMount(PlatformProperties), FileUtils.getFolderByRelativePath(Architecture, String, String[])

      • isUsingLocalMount

        public boolean isUsingLocalMount​(PlatformProperties properties)
        Returns true if this platform module is using a local mount for client staging location access. Extensions of this class may take the given properties into account when determining whether a local mount is being used. If a null properties reference is given then this method should return true if it ever allows a local staging location mapping to be used.

        This base implementation returns false to indicate that by default no local staging location mount is being used.

        Warning: The given PlatformProperties parameter may be null.

        Parameters:
        properties - the PlatformProperties configured for the stream in question. This parameter may be null.
        Returns:
        true if a local mount should be used or false if no local mount is available.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Disposes of any resources allocated by this PlatformModule. This method will be called for PlatformModules that are initialized unless the Java VM is terminated abnormally.

      • isTaskBundlingSupported

        public boolean isTaskBundlingSupported​(PlatformProperties platform)
        Returns true if this platform module supports the bundling of more than one task into a single job submission.

        The default implementation returns false to indicate that bundling tasks into single batch jobs is NOT supported by this platform.

        Parameters:
        platform - the PlatformDefinition that describes the platform that the tasks will be submitted to.
        Returns:
        true if task bundling is supported; false otherwise
        See Also:
        getMaxScheduledJobs(PlatformProperties), getScheduledJobLimit(PlatformProperties), getScheduledJobLimitInterval(PlatformProperties)

      • getMaxScheduledJobs

        public int getMaxScheduledJobs​(PlatformProperties properties)
        Returns the maximum number of (batch)jobs that should be scheduled concurrently for a job stream with the given properties. Jobs beyond this number will blocked until previously submitted tasks have completed.

        In this context a 'Job' is one or more tasks that will be submitted by the StreamManager as a single entry in the batch queuing system.

        This default implementation returns Integer.MAX_VALUE to indicate no maximum number of scheduled jobs.

        Parameters:
        properties - the PlatformProperties describing the platform
        Returns:
        the maximum number of jobs or Integer.MAX_VALUE to indicate no maximum value.
        See Also:
        getScheduledJobLimit(PlatformProperties), getScheduledJobLimitInterval(PlatformProperties)

      • getScheduledJobLimit

        public int getScheduledJobLimit​(PlatformProperties properties)
        Returns the absolute maximum number of batch jobs that may be scheduled concurrently by this platform module on the given platform. The number returned by this method will be used as an absolute upper limit that takes precedence over getMaxScheduledJobs(PlatformProperties).

        This method differs from getMaxScheduledJobs(PlatformProperties) in that this number cannot be changed by the user. It is intended to reflect a reasonable upper limit for the batch queuing system rather than the behavior of an individual job stream.

        This default implementation returns Integer.MAX_VALUE to indicate no limit to the number of jobs that may be scheduled concurrently.

        Parameters:
        properties - the PlatformProperties describing the platform
        Returns:
        the absolute upper limit to the number of jobs or Integer.MAX_VALUE to indicate no limit.
        See Also:
        getMaxScheduledJobs(PlatformProperties)

      • getScheduledJobLimitInterval

        public int getScheduledJobLimitInterval​(PlatformProperties properties)
        Returns the number of seconds that the Stream Manager should wait between checks for changes to the scheduled job limit.

        Note: This method may be called quite often from the Stream Manager's main event processing thread and thus must return as quickly as possible to avoid delaying stream execution.

        This default implementation returns 0 to indicate that no scheduled job limit updates should be performed.

        Parameters:
        properties - the PlatformProperties describing the platform
        Returns:
        the number of seconds between scheduled job limit updates
        See Also:
        getScheduledJobLimit(PlatformProperties), getMaxScheduledJobs(PlatformProperties)

      • getQueueCheckInterval

        public int getQueueCheckInterval​(PlatformProperties properties)
        Returns the number of seconds that the Stream Manager should wait for queued tasks to send startup notification before their status is checked via getStatus(String[], PlatformProperties).

        Note: This method may be called quite often from the Stream Manager's main event processing thread and thus must return as quickly as possible to avoid delaying stream execution.

        This default implementation returns 0 to indicate that no fallback queue checks should be performed.

        Parameters:
        properties - the PlatformProperties describing the platform
        Returns:
        the number of seconds between fallback queue status checks

      • getLogger

        public final StreamLogger getLogger()
        Retrieves the logger instance for this PlatformModule that can be used to display error, warning, etc. messages to the user or log file depending on where this module is loaded.

        In most cases the pass-through logging methods (such as error(String)) should be used instead to ensure that the messages are all prefixed with the module name.

        Returns:
        the Logger instance for this platform module.
        See Also:
        critical(String), error(String), warning(String), info(String)

      • replaceTokens

        public java.lang.String replaceTokens​(java.lang.String path,
                                      PlatformProperties properties)
        This method performs a tokenized replacement of the following tokens:
        • ${USERID} - The current user's userid.
        • ${USERID_LOWER} - The current user's userid in lower case letters.
        • ${USERID_UPPER} - The current user's userid in upper case letters.
        • ${SNAPINSTALL} - The SNAP installation folder

        This method is used during submission and by PlatformModule implementations to replace tokens in the Staging Location, SNAP Installation, and ApplicationDefinition locations included in site configuration.

        Parameters:
        path - a String containing the staging location path to parse
        properties - the PlatformProperties describing the submission process
        Returns:
        a String containing the resulting path with each of the above tokens replaced with an appropriate value.

      • replaceTokens

        public StagingLocation replaceTokens​(StagingLocation location,
                                     PlatformProperties properties)
        Returns a new StagingLocation after performing a tokenized replacement of the given location.
        See Also:
        replaceTokens(StagingLocation, PlatformProperties), replaceTokens(String, PlatformProperties)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • cleanupStream

        public void cleanupStream​(Stream stream,
                          TrackerModule trackerModule)
        This method is intended to allow Platform Modules to perform-specific cleanup operations at the end of the stream execution process. It is called just before the final stream definition is written out, and before the TrackerModule or PlatformModule are disposed.

        Note that this method will be called during the stream shutdown process regardless of whether the stream's tasks were executed. Because of this, one or more of the given parameters may be null or incomplete.

        Parameters:
        stream - the Stream definition
        trackerModule - the TrackerModule used by the stream to communicate with the tracking server defined for the stream

      • isClient

        public boolean isClient()
        Returns true if this module was initialized for use by a client application or false if it was initialized for use by the Stream Manager.

      • getCustomOptions

        public OptionDescription[] getCustomOptions()
        Returns the set of "custom options" available for platform definitions of this type. PlatformModule implementations may provide a set of custom options that will be used to help the user define Platform Definitions.
        See Also:
        OptionDescription

      • requestShutdown

        public static void requestShutdown()
        Indicates to all platform module implementations that the currently executing application has begun its shutdown process.
        See Also:
        isShutdownRequested()
